# Creator updates

Use this article to stay up-to-date with the latest creator updates. For other topics, check out these articles:

  * Policy updates
  * Viewer updates

 _Monthly roundup from the YouTube Creators channel_ Subscribe to the YouTube Creators channel for the latest news, updates, and tips.

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/9072033?hl=en&ref_topic=13401449
[CATEGORY]: Learn about recent updates on YouTube

# Creator updates

Use this article to stay up-to-date with the latest creator updates. For other topics, check out these articles:

## Latest YouTube updates

 _Updates from the past 4 weeks_

**YouTube Studio**

  * **Studio mobile app update:** The Studio mobile app versions 23.32 and below will not be supported starting 3 September 2025. Download the latest version from the Play Store or App Store to continue using the app.

  * **The Inspiration Tab has been launched globally:** The Inspiration Tab is now available on the Content page in YouTube Studio on desktop in all global markets, including the United Kingdom, European Union, and Switzerland. The Inspiration Tab lets you explore ideas with the assistance of AI tools to brainstorm your next video. Learn more about the Inspiration Tab.

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/9072033?hl=en&ref_topic=13401449
[CATEGORY]: Learn about recent updates on YouTube

# Creator updates

Use this article to stay up-to-date with the latest creator updates. For other topics, check out these articles:

## Previous YouTube updates

### June 2025

**Community and comments**

  * **Communities availability update:** All creators 16+ with access to Posts can now opt-in to use Communities. Communities is a dedicated space for you and your subscribers to connect with each other right from your channel. By fostering ongoing discussions and fan-to-fan connections, Communities help cultivate a more engaged and loyal audience. Learn more about starting a Community and moderating your Community.

**YouTube Studio**

  * **Advanced mode refreshes with new features:** Starting in June 2025, the Advanced mode creator experience will be refreshed. Improvements include more intuitive navigation and layout, which added new features providing more granular data without being overwhelming. These changes will gradually roll out to all creators in the coming weeks. Learn more.

**Other updates**

  * **Stickers on shoppable Shorts:** Now, when you tag products in your Shorts, viewers will get a fun visualization of the first tagged product, in the form of a shopping product sticker. Shopping product stickers will replace the Shopping button for all Shorts with tagged products. Learn more.

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/9072033?hl=en&ref_topic=13401449
[CATEGORY]: Learn about recent updates on YouTube

# Creator updates

Use this article to stay up-to-date with the latest creator updates. For other topics, check out these articles:

## Previous YouTube updates

### May 2025

**Other updates**

  * **Ad suitability additional reviews:** Starting May 12, 2025, we’re making improvements to our ad suitability review process. As a result, we may conduct additional reviews that may be human on new video uploads, even if visibility is set to private. In some cases, video monetization decisions may take up to 24 hours. This update is designed to improve the accuracy of monetization decisions and increase your channel’s overall monetization potential. Learn more.

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/9072033?hl=en&ref_topic=13401449
[CATEGORY]: Learn about recent updates on YouTube

# Creator updates

Use this article to stay up-to-date with the latest creator updates. For other topics, check out these articles:

## Previous YouTube updates

### April 2025

**Other updates**

  * **Location Auto Tagging:** We're expanding auto tagged locations to travel & restaurant-related Shorts to help viewers find locally relevant content. Location tags, based on your Short’s title & description, may appear as an overlay in the Shorts player.

You can adjust or opt-out of auto tagged locations in Studio. Learn more.

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/9072033?hl=en&ref_topic=13401449
[CATEGORY]: Learn about recent updates on YouTube

# Creator updates

Use this article to stay up-to-date with the latest creator updates. For other topics, check out these articles:

## Previous YouTube updates

### March 2025

**YouTube Studio**

  * **Studio mobile app update:** The Studio mobile app versions 23.10 and below will not be supported starting 3 March 2025. Download the latest version from the Play Store or App Store to continue using the app.

**Other updates**

  * **Automatic dubbing language update:** For creators with access to auto dubbing, the following “experimental” languages: Hindi, Indonesian, and Japanese, are no longer considered “experimental.” They will now be included with the other non-experimental languages and will be auto-published in accordance to your settings if you have auto publish turned on. Learn more.

  * **Changes to Shorts view counting:** Starting 3/31/2025, we're updating how we count Shorts views. This update may increase your Shorts views, providing a more complete view of how your Shorts are performing, especially if you share content on different platforms. The previous Shorts views metric will now be called “Engaged views.”

This change won't impact your eligibility for the YouTube Partner Program (YPP), Shorts revenue sharing, or earnings. These will continue to be based on "Engaged views". Learn more.

  * **Updates to the "Video Copyright Details" page:** We're updating the design to the "Video Copyright Details" page to make it more intuitive and help you find relevant information faster. You can now better understand the critical information about your channel's status, video's visibility, and monetization after you receive a copyright claim or strike. Learn more.

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/9072033?hl=en&ref_topic=13401449
[CATEGORY]: Learn about recent updates on YouTube

# YouTube viewer updates

Use this article to stay up to date with all the latest changes on YouTube. If you're a video creator, read about changes to creator tools and features under Creator Updates.

## Previous YouTube updates

### November 2024

  * **Viewer Notes:** Eligible viewers can now add brief, informative notes on videos, providing helpful context and details not apparent in the video. Learn more about eligibility and how to get started.

  * **Comments in YouTube Music** : You can now comment on songs, videos, and podcast episodes in the YouTube Music app on iOS and Android. Comments are a great way to express yourself and connect with other YouTube users. Learn more.

# Get help as a YouTube user

####  YouTube Help Center

You're already here, the best place for all things troubleshooting. You can find the Help button at the bottom of any YouTube page, the bottom of the left menu, or at support.google.com/youtube.

####  YouTube Help video channels

Check out our YouTube Viewers channel for videos that keep you up-to-date and help you learn how to use our products.

####  YouTube Help Community

Find answers in the YouTube Help Community - powered by TeamYouTube. You can view featured posts to see the latest updates from TeamYouTube.

####  @TeamYouTube X handle

Follow us @TeamYouTube on X, formerly known as Twitter, for real-time updates and troubleshooting tips to help you get the most out of YouTube.

Our team shares updates and answers questions in English, Spanish, Portuguese, German, French, Russian, Japanese, Indonesian, Arabic, and Hindi.

Learn more about TeamYouTube.

#### Copyright questions

  * **Copyright and rights management**: Get information, troubleshooting, and next steps if you've been affected by rights claims.
  * **Legal policies** : Get information about what these legal issues are and how to file a complaint.

#### Policy questions

Use these tools to understand YouTube's policies, safety practices, and reporting tools:

  * **Safety tools and resources** : Learn about YouTube tools and resources, and get tips on many topics.
  * **Community Guidelines** : Guidelines to help keep YouTube fun and enjoyable for everyone.
  * Reporting and enforcement tools: Learn how to report content on YouTube and how we enforce our Community Guidelines.

**Note** : Some resources are only available in limited languages.

Give feedback about this articleChoose a section to give feedback on

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/9396735?hl=en&ref_topic=13343244
[CATEGORY]: Get help with YouTube

# Get help as a YouTube Creator

### Get in touch with the Creator Support team

If your channel is eligible (for example, if you're in the YouTube Partner Program), you can get in touch with the YouTube Creator Support Team for help. 

Learn how to get in touch with the Creator Support team.

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/6249136?hl=en&ref_topic=13343244

# Get help as a YouTube Creator

### Get in touch with the Creator Support team

### Use our Help Center, community forum, and @TeamYouTube

####  YouTube Help Center

You're already here, the best place for troubleshooting. At the bottom of any YouTube page, get back here anytime by clicking the **Help** button. You can also go to `support.google.com/youtube`.

Make sure to check out these sections just for you:

  * **For creators:** Get help creating videos and managing your channel.
  * **For partners:** Get help monetizing your content and collaborating with other partners.

####  YouTube Help video channels

Check out our YouTube Viewers channel for videos that keep you up-to-date with the latest news and tips.

Check out our YouTube Creators channel for best practice videos to help you grow your channel and build your business on YouTube.

####  YouTube Help Community

Find answers in the YouTube Help Community - powered by TeamYouTube. You can view featured posts to see the latest updates from TeamYouTube. TeamYouTube is a team of Community Managers who work closely with all YouTube teams to share real-time updates and help. They also champion your feedback within the company.

####  @TeamYouTube X handle

Follow us @TeamYouTube on X for real-time updates and troubleshooting tips to help you get the most out of YouTube.

Our team shares updates and answers questions in English, French, German, Portuguese, Russian, Spanish, Japanese, and Bahasa.

Learn more about TeamYouTube.

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/6249136?hl=en&ref_topic=13343244
[CATEGORY]: Get help with YouTube

# Get help as a YouTube Creator

### Get in touch with the Creator Support team

### Develop your skills

####  YouTube Creator Tips

YouTube Creator Tips is your home for education for new creators. You can find tips, best practices, and strategies for Video, Live stream, and Shorts content.

####  YouTube for Creators

YouTube for Creators is the best place to learn about all the programs, tools, and upcoming events that can help you create better videos. You can also get help growing your channel with the YouTube for Creators benefits program.

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/6249136?hl=en&ref_topic=13343244
[CATEGORY]: Get help with YouTube

# Get help from @TeamYouTube on X

TeamYouTube, YouTube’s support and education team, delivers timely updates and answers to creators, viewers, and paid subscribers on X, formerly known as Twitter @TeamYouTube. Here’s a little more about us:

  * Our handle is monitored around the clock starting on Mondays at 9 AM PT until Friday at 5 PM PT.
  * Our team shares updates and answers questions in English, Spanish, Portuguese, German, French, Japanese, Indonesian, Arabic, Hindi, and Korean.
  * While we do our best to monitor questions and requests for support that tag other official YouTube handles like, @YouTube or @YouTubeCreators, the quickest way to get help is by tagging @TeamYouTube.

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/13646088?hl=en&ref_topic=13343244
[CATEGORY]: Get help with YouTube

# Get help from @TeamYouTube on X

TeamYouTube, YouTube’s support and education team, delivers timely updates and answers to creators, viewers, and paid subscribers on X, formerly known as Twitter @TeamYouTube. Here’s a little more about us:

## Learn more about @TeamYouTube on X

### What should I include when reaching out to @TeamYouTube?

If you’re tweeting publicly, don’t include any personally identifiable information, such as your email address, phone number, or credit card details just to name a few.

When tagging @TeamYouTube for help, make sure to include relevant info like:

  * Channel or video URL.
  * Screenshots of the particular issue or topic as you’re seeing it.
  * The device you’re using, like an iPhone.
  * Screenshot of your Stats for Nerds if you’re having trouble with YouTube TV.

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/13646088?hl=en&ref_topic=13343244
[CATEGORY]: Get help with YouTube

# Get help from @TeamYouTube on X

TeamYouTube, YouTube’s support and education team, delivers timely updates and answers to creators, viewers, and paid subscribers on X, formerly known as Twitter @TeamYouTube. Here’s a little more about us:

## Learn more about @TeamYouTube on X

### Are there situations @TeamYouTube can’t help with?

There are some situations where @TeamYouTube can’t help:

  * Issues happening on a non-Google product, like Amazon Fire Stick or Roku, or other service.
  * Copyright disputes with a rightsholder.
  * Legal disputes.
  * Reactivating or removing Google AdSense accounts.
  * If your channel has been hacked, reach out to Creator Support.
  * You disagree with a policy decision.

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/13646088?hl=en&ref_topic=13343244
[CATEGORY]: Get help with YouTube

# Get help from @TeamYouTube on X

TeamYouTube, YouTube’s support and education team, delivers timely updates and answers to creators, viewers, and paid subscribers on X, formerly known as Twitter @TeamYouTube. Here’s a little more about us:

## Learn more about @TeamYouTube on X

### I have an issue with a YouTube paid product, can @TeamYouTube help?

You can reach out to @TeamYouTube on X for quick questions or feedback related for paid products.

For the support issues unique to your account or memberships, it’s best to get in touch with YouTube Support via email, phone, or chat for paid products since those may require personal information like your phone number or email. This could include questions related to

  * Billing
  * Adding or removing packages
  * Managing a subscription
  * Forgotten passwords and account lockouts
  * Channel terminations that have already been appealed

You can get in touch with YouTube Support in the links below:

  * YouTube TV Support
  * YouTube Premium Support
  * YouTube Music Support

**Need help with a refund?**

@TeamYouTube can’t help with refunds, but for many products, you can start them yourself. Here’s some more info about paid product refunds.

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/13646088?hl=en&ref_topic=13343244
[CATEGORY]: Get help with YouTube

# Trending Charts on YouTube

YouTube Charts provide a dynamic daily spotlight on the most popular content from across the globe.

Charts vary by category, but you can find trending Charts for select content categories like Trending Movie Trailers and Trending Music Videos, and for Trending Gaming Videos via the Gaming Explore page.

Trending Charts aren’t personalized and display the same trending videos to all viewers in the same country, which is why you may see videos in Charts that aren't in the same language as your browser.

Trending Charts are updated roughly every 30 minutes. With each update, videos may move up, move down or stay in the same position in the Chart.

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/7239739?hl=en&ref_topic=9257501
[CATEGORY]: Find videos to watch__Find videos on YouTube

# Trending Charts on YouTube

YouTube Charts provide a dynamic daily spotlight on the most popular content from across the globe.

## What determines if a video is ranked on Charts?

Amongst the many great new videos on YouTube on any given day, trending Charts can only show a limited number. Trending Charts aim to surface videos that:

  * Are relevant to the topic of the chart 
  * Are growing quickly
  * Are not misleading, clickbaity or sensational
  * Showcase a diversity of creators

Charts aim to balance all of these considerations. To achieve this, Trending considers many signals, including (but not limited to):

  * View count
  * How quickly the video’s view count (or ‘temperature’) is growing
  * Where views are coming from, including outside of YouTube
  * The topic of the videos
  * The age of the video
  * How the video performs compared to other recent uploads from the same channel

As these signals are combined to produce charts automatically, the video with the highest view count on a given day may not be #1 on a given trending chart, and videos with more views may be shown below videos with fewer views.

**Note:** Views from YouTube ads are not included in a video’s view count when measuring videos for trending charts.

We're very careful about the safety of what appears on trending charts, so we have filters to make sure that we don't show videos that contain excessive profanity, mature content or violence, or videos that are otherwise inappropriate, such as disparaging others in the community.  
  
YouTube doesn't accept payment for placement on trending charts and doesn't favor specific creators.

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/7239739?hl=en&ref_topic=9257501
[CATEGORY]: Find videos to watch__Find videos on YouTube

# Trending Charts on YouTube

YouTube Charts provide a dynamic daily spotlight on the most popular content from across the globe.

## Privacy settings for trending videos

A video can only appear on Charts if its privacy setting is public. Certain videos may be hidden from Charts if Restricted Mode is turned on. Learn more about Restricted Mode here.

Give feedback about this articleChoose a section to give feedback on

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/7239739?hl=en&ref_topic=9257501

# Manage your recommendations & search results

There are several ways to influence your YouTube recommendations and search results. We give you the option to let us know when certain content might not be of interest to you, such as a video or a channel, and you can manage your Google Account activity, like videos, and more.You can also edit, turn off, or delete your watch and search history to refine your recommendations. Learn more about how to manage your watch history and search history.

If you don’t want video recommendations on Home, you can delete and turn off your watch history.

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/6342839?hl=en&ref_topic=9257501
[CATEGORY]: Find videos to watch__Find videos on YouTube

# Manage your recommendations & search results

There are several ways to influence your YouTube recommendations and search results. We give you the option to let us know when certain content might not be of interest to you, such as a video or a channel, and you can manage your Google Account activity, like videos, and more.

## Tune your recommendations

One of the ways you can influence your recommendations is by tuning them to be more relevant to you and your interests. When you give us feedback, like when a video on your Home feed isn’t interesting to you, it helps us improve your YouTube experience in the future.

**Note:** Some of these features are only available if you are signed in to your account.

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/6342839?hl=en&ref_topic=9257501
[CATEGORY]: Find videos to watch__Find videos on YouTube

# Manage your recommendations & search results

There are several ways to influence your YouTube recommendations and search results. We give you the option to let us know when certain content might not be of interest to you, such as a video or a channel, and you can manage your Google Account activity, like videos, and more.

## Tune your recommendations

### Mark content as “Not interested”

You can mark when you’re “Not interested” in a video on certain pages, such as your Home and Watch Next pages.

  1. Go to the recommended video you’re not interested in.
  2. Press and hold the select button on your remote.
  3. Select **Not** **interested**.
  4. Select **Tell** **us** **why** to share why you’re not interested in the video. You can select **I’ve** **already** **watched** **the video** , **I** **don’t** **like** **the** **video** , or **Don’t** **recommend** **channel** to customize your recommendations.

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/6342839?hl=en&ref_topic=9257501
[CATEGORY]: Find videos to watch__Find videos on YouTube

# Manage your recommendations & search results

There are several ways to influence your YouTube recommendations and search results. We give you the option to let us know when certain content might not be of interest to you, such as a video or a channel, and you can manage your Google Account activity, like videos, and more.

## Tune your recommendations

### Clear the "Top channels you watch" shelf on your search page

  1. On the left menu, select **Settings** .
  2. Under “HISTORY & DATA,” settings **Clear** **search** **history**.
  3. On the confirmation page, select **Clear** **search** **history**.

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/6342839?hl=en&ref_topic=9257501
[CATEGORY]: Find videos to watch__Find videos on YouTube

# Manage your recommendations & search results

There are several ways to influence your YouTube recommendations and search results. We give you the option to let us know when certain content might not be of interest to you, such as a video or a channel, and you can manage your Google Account activity, like videos, and more.

## Tune your recommendations

### Clear “Not interested” & “Don’t recommend channel” feedback

Your “Not Interested” and “Don’t recommend channel” feedback may be used to tune your recommendations. To clear all the “Not interested” and “Don’t recommend channel” feedback you've submitted, please follow the instructions above using your computer, Android, or iPhone or iPad.

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/6342839?hl=en&ref_topic=9257501
[CATEGORY]: Find videos to watch__Find videos on YouTube

# Manage your recommendations & search results

There are several ways to influence your YouTube recommendations and search results. We give you the option to let us know when certain content might not be of interest to you, such as a video or a channel, and you can manage your Google Account activity, like videos, and more.

## Tune your recommendations

### Manage recommendations from your Google Activity

YouTube may also use data from your Google Account activity to influence your recommendations, search results, in-app notifications, and suggested videos in other places.

You can view and control your activity at myactivity.google.com. Learn more about controlling activity for your Google Account.

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/6342839?hl=en&ref_topic=9257501
[CATEGORY]: Find videos to watch__Find videos on YouTube

# Manage your recommendations & search results

There are several ways to influence your YouTube recommendations and search results. We give you the option to let us know when certain content might not be of interest to you, such as a video or a channel, and you can manage your Google Account activity, like videos, and more.

## Tune your recommendations

### Mark content as “Not interested”

There are several ways to influence your YouTube recommendations and search results, including letting us know when certain content might not be of interest to you, such as a video or a channel.

  1. Click More next to the title of the video, playlist, or section on Home.
  2. Click **Not** **interested** .
  3. If it’s a video, click **Tell us why** to share why you’re not interested. You can select **I’ve already watched the video** or **I don’t like the video** to further customize your recommendations.

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/6342839?hl=en&ref_topic=9257501
[CATEGORY]: Find videos to watch__Find videos on YouTube

# Manage your recommendations & search results

There are several ways to influence your YouTube recommendations and search results. We give you the option to let us know when certain content might not be of interest to you, such as a video or a channel, and you can manage your Google Account activity, like videos, and more.

## Tune your recommendations

### Adjust channel recommendations

  1. On certain pages, such as your Home and Watch Next pages, find a video from a channel that you don’t want recommended to you.
  2. Click More next to the video title.
  3. Select **Don't recommend channel** .

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/6342839?hl=en&ref_topic=9257501
[CATEGORY]: Find videos to watch__Find videos on YouTube

# Manage your recommendations & search results

There are several ways to influence your YouTube recommendations and search results. We give you the option to let us know when certain content might not be of interest to you, such as a video or a channel, and you can manage your Google Account activity, like videos, and more.

## Tune your recommendations

### Clear “Not interested” & “Don’t recommend channel” feedback

If you don’t want your “Not interested” and “Don’t recommend channel” feedback to influence your recommendations, you can clear it.

  1. Go to My Activity.You might need to sign in to your Google Account.
  2. Find **Other Google activity** in the left-hand menu or under the My Activity banner.
  3. Select **YouTube 'Not interested' feedback** , then select **Delete.**

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/6342839?hl=en&ref_topic=9257501

# Manage your recommendations & search results

There are several ways to influence your YouTube recommendations and search results. We give you the option to let us know when certain content might not be of interest to you, such as a video or a channel, and you can manage your Google Account activity, like videos, and more.

## Tune your recommendations

### See fewer Shorts

On certain pages, such as your Home and Watch Next pages, you may also be recommended Shorts to watch. You can choose to see fewer of these.

  1. On the YouTube app, go to your Home feed.
  2. Scroll to a grid of Shorts.
  3. At the top of the grid, tap More .
  4. Tap **Show** **fewer** **Shorts**.

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/6342839?hl=en&ref_topic=9257501

# Manage your recommendations & search results

There are several ways to influence your YouTube recommendations and search results. We give you the option to let us know when certain content might not be of interest to you, such as a video or a channel, and you can manage your Google Account activity, like videos, and more.

## Tune your recommendations

### Clear “Show fewer Shorts“ response

If you opted to be shown fewer Shorts, you can clear this decision in My Activity.

  1. Go to My Activity.
  2. Find and select **Other** **activity** in the left-hand menu or under the My Activity banner.
  3. Under “Show fewer Shorts,” select **Delete**.

# Manage your recommendations & search results

There are several ways to influence your YouTube recommendations and search results. We give you the option to let us know when certain content might not be of interest to you, such as a video or a channel, and you can manage your Google Account activity, like videos, and more.

## Explore recommended topics

If you only want to see recommended content about a specific subject, explore topics on the Home and watch pages. Topics are based on your existing, personalized suggestions and on content related to what you interact with. These topics are meant to help you find content you want to watch faster. For example, a topic called “Learning” may have educational videos.

If you find a video that isn’t related to the topic you’ve chosen on Home, let us know by tapping More beside the video **Not** **< topic>** .

# Find music from artists you like

You can subscribe to music artists and get notifications from their channels to stay updated on their latest music, videos, and tours.

## Subscribe to an artist

You can subscribe to an artist just like any other creator on YouTube by following these steps:

  1. Sign in to YouTube.
  2. Go to a video of the artist you like.
  3. Under the video player, click or tap **SUBSCRIBE**.

Once you subscribe, any new videos published by the artist will show up in your Subscriptions feed. Learn about subscribing to channels. You can also subscribe to artists on channel pages.

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/7636475?hl=en&ref_topic=9257501
[CATEGORY]: Find videos to watch__Find videos on YouTube

# Find music from artists you like

You can subscribe to music artists and get notifications from their channels to stay updated on their latest music, videos, and tours.

## Types of channels an artist can have

An artist can have more than one type of channel on YouTube:

  * A channel the artist manages themselves.
  * A partner-provided channel, which is managed by a YouTube Music distribution partner (like a record label).
  * A topic channel, which YouTube auto-generates. These channels are titled “Artist Name - Topic” and say “auto-generated by YouTube” in the channel’s About section. Learn about auto-generated topic channels for artists below.
  * An Official Artist Channel , a collection of an artist’s music and videos from across all their different YouTube channels. You can find an artist's Official Artist Channel (OAC) by searching for the artist on YouTube. You can also find their OAC by watching an artist's official music video. Learn about Official Artist Channels.

If you’re already subscribed to an artist’s topic channel or partner-provided channel, you’ll automatically be subscribed to their Official Artist Channel when it’s created. Notifications will then be sent from the artist's Official Artist Channel. Learn about notifications from artists below.

Once subscribed to an artist’s Official Artist Channel, your subscriptions to their topic channel and partner-provided channel will be inactive. This means they’ll no longer be in your subscriptions list. You can still find an artist's topic channel or partner-provided channel in Search, but these channels will no longer have a subscribe button.

As always, you can manage your subscriptions for any channel you subscribe to, including Official Artist Channels.

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/7636475?hl=en&ref_topic=9257501
[CATEGORY]: Find videos to watch__Find videos on YouTube

# Find music from artists you like

You can subscribe to music artists and get notifications from their channels to stay updated on their latest music, videos, and tours.

## Notifications from artists

Once you subscribe to a channel, you may start getting notifications when the channel publishes new videos. By default, we'll only send you the highlights from the channel. Learn how to manage your notifications.

If an artist has an Official Artist Channel, you'll only get notifications from their official channel in your subscriptions feed.

The type of notifications you'll get from an Official Artist Channel depends on the notification preferences you've had for other channels from the artist:

  * If you’ve set bell notifications on the Official Artist Channel, you'll get bell notifications regardless of your setting on other channels. 
  * If you've set highlights on the Official Artist Channel, you'll get highlights regardless of your setting on other channels. 
  * If you have any other notification setting on the Official Artist Channel, and you have either bell notifications or no notifications set on the partner-provided channel, then the Official Artist Channel will get the notification settings from the partner-provided channel.
  * Preferences from a topic channel do not affect your notification settings for the Official Artist Channel.

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/7636475?hl=en&ref_topic=9257501
[CATEGORY]: Find videos to watch__Find videos on YouTube

## Music release notifications in Shorts

Some music preview pages in Shorts may have the option to get notifications when the full-length song is available.

To get release notifications in Shorts, tap **Notify me** from an eligible sound or Shorts preview page. On the day of the release, tap on the notification to start listening to the release or album track.

**Note:** You can sign up for notifications if the label/distributor has allowed this feature for their release.

# Find music from artists you like

You can subscribe to music artists and get notifications from their channels to stay updated on their latest music, videos, and tours.

## Auto-generated topic channels for artists

You may see both a topic channel and an Official Artist channel in Search. An artist’s topic channel is auto-generated by YouTube and is titled “Artist Name - Topic.” If an artist doesn’t have an Official Artist Channel, you can subscribe to their topic channel. This will add the topic channel to your subscriptions list, but will not add any videos to your subscriptions feed. You won’t get notifications from topic channels.

If you’re an artist with a topic channel, we recommend setting up an Official Artist Channel.

# Find music from artists you like

You can subscribe to music artists and get notifications from their channels to stay updated on their latest music, videos, and tours.

## Auto-generated topic channels for artists

### How does YouTube decide when to auto-generate a topic channel for an artist?

A topic channel is created for an artist when they have a significant presence on YouTube. If an artist doesn't have a topic channel, it may be because:

  * There are only a few videos from the artist.
  * The artist’s videos do not have many views.
  * The artist’s videos don't meet YouTube's quality standards.

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/7636475?hl=en&ref_topic=9257501
[CATEGORY]: Find videos to watch__Find videos on YouTube

# Find music from artists you like

You can subscribe to music artists and get notifications from their channels to stay updated on their latest music, videos, and tours.

## Auto-generated topic channels for artists

### How does YouTube decide what content goes into an artist's topic channel?

Using algorithms, YouTube figures out the central topics in a video and uses that info to develop video collections for an artist. Topic channels can contain content from an artist channel, as well as user-generated content. These channels don't convey any editorial opinion on the part of YouTube.

# Official Cards in Search

Official Cards make it easier for viewers to discover content by highlighting official material in YouTube Search. These cards include official videos from top channels, like those of top YouTube creators, celebrities, and music artists, as well as content related to sports teams, movies and tv, music, and special events. These cards are automatically generated and do not allow for customization.

# Find videos with voice search

Use voice search to find videos.

### Start a voice search

  1. Sign in to YouTube.
  2. Tap **Search** .
  3. Tap **Mic** .
  4. Allow access to the microphone.
  5. Recording will start immediately.
  6. Tap to end the recording.
  7. Tap **X** to go back or cancel the recording.

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/9372650?hl=en&ref_topic=9257501
[CATEGORY]: Find videos to watch__Find videos on YouTube

# Find videos with voice search

Use voice search to find videos.

### Change microphone permissions

  1. If you have previously denied microphone permissions, you may see a request to allow microphone permissions via your phone settings.
  2. Click the prompt to go to phone settings, or access Android Settings from your Android phone’s general menu.
  3. From Android settings, click Apps and Notifications.
  4. Find the YouTube app and click YouTube settings.
  5. Click Permissions.
  6. Switch the microphone permission to **On**.
  7. Go back to the YouTube app, and you should now be able to search with your voice.

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/9372650?hl=en&ref_topic=9257501
[CATEGORY]: Find videos to watch__Find videos on YouTube

# Find videos with voice search

Use voice search to find videos.

### Song search

You can search YouTube using sound. By humming or recording a song that’s currently being played, you can find related YouTube videos, Shorts, and official music content.To start a song search:

  1. Sign in to YouTube.
  2. Tap **Search** .
  3. Tap **Mic** .
  4. Allow access to the microphone.
  5. Tap **Song** .
  6. Recording will start immediately and end once the song is identified.
  7. Tap **X** to go back or cancel the recording.

**Note:** If the song can’t be identified, you’ll get an error message letting you know a match wasn’t found.

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/9372650?hl=en&ref_topic=9257501
[CATEGORY]: Find videos to watch__Find videos on YouTube

# Find videos faster

When you start a search on YouTube, you can find what you’re looking for more quickly with automated suggestions. These are called search predictions. These predictions come from possible search terms related to what you’re looking for and what other people have already searched for.

## How search predictions work

YouTube makes search predictions based on factors like popularity or similarity. When you choose a prediction, you’ll find results for what you just chose.

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/9872296?hl=en&ref_topic=9257501
[CATEGORY]: Find videos to watch__Find videos on YouTube

# Find videos faster

When you start a search on YouTube, you can find what you’re looking for more quickly with automated suggestions. These are called search predictions. These predictions come from possible search terms related to what you’re looking for and what other people have already searched for.

## Where search predictions come from

  * Search terms you enter.
  * If you’re signed in to your Google Account, and depending on your settings, relevant searches you’ve done or videos you’ve watched in the past.
  * What other people are searching for, including trending searches. Trending searches are popular topics in your area that change during the day and aren’t related to your search history.

**Note:** Search predictions aren’t the answer to your search. They also aren’t statements by other people or YouTube about your search terms.

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/9872296?hl=en&ref_topic=9257501
[CATEGORY]: Find videos to watch__Find videos on YouTube

# Find videos faster

When you start a search on YouTube, you can find what you’re looking for more quickly with automated suggestions. These are called search predictions. These predictions come from possible search terms related to what you’re looking for and what other people have already searched for.

## Why you might not see search predictions

If you don’t see any predictions for a search term, the algorithm might have found that:

  * The search term isn't popular.
  * The search term is too new. You might need to wait a few days or weeks to see predictions.
  * An insulting or sensitive term was associated with a name and a rule was applied.
  * Users have reported the suggestion as inappropriate.
  * The search term violates YouTube’s policies. Learn more about Autocomplete policies.

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/9872296?hl=en&ref_topic=9257501
[CATEGORY]: Find videos to watch__Find videos on YouTube

# Find videos faster

When you start a search on YouTube, you can find what you’re looking for more quickly with automated suggestions. These are called search predictions. These predictions come from possible search terms related to what you’re looking for and what other people have already searched for.

## Turn off personalized predictions

You may see personalized predictions whether you’re signed in or signed out. To turn off personalized search predictions, you can turn off and delete your search history and watch history.

**Note:** Trending search suggestions are not personalized and may continue to appear.

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/9872296?hl=en&ref_topic=9257501

# Find videos faster

When you start a search on YouTube, you can find what you’re looking for more quickly with automated suggestions. These are called search predictions. These predictions come from possible search terms related to what you’re looking for and what other people have already searched for.

## Report a prediction

While we do our best to prevent inappropriate predictions, we don't always get it right. If you think a prediction violates one of the Autocomplete policies, here's how to report it on Web:

  1. In the search bar, at the bottom of the prediction box, click **Report search predictions**.
  2. Give your feedback.
  3. Select Send.

We'll look over your feedback but we don't automatically remove reported predictions.

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/9872296?hl=en&ref_topic=9257501

# Find videos using hashtags

Hashtags are keywords preceded by a # symbol, and they are an easy way to find videos about popular topics on YouTube.

There are two ways to find videos using hashtags:

  * Enter a hashtag in the Search bar.
  * Select a hashtag in a video title, below a video title, or in a video description.
  * Go to the Explore tab and select a trending hashtag.

Searching or selecting a hashtag will show you a results page with videos that include that hashtag in either their title or description.

Give feedback about this articleChoose a section to give feedback on

[SOURCE]: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/10806146?hl=en&ref_topic=9257501
